KAT-NO-HSTS.description: The website does not use HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). Via HSTS the browser is configured to only connect via a proper secured HTTPS connection to the website.

KAT-NO-CSP.description: The website does not use a Content Security Policy configuration.

KAT-NO-X-PERMITTED-CROSS-DOMAIN-POLICIES.description: The HTTP header X-Permitted-Cross-Domain- Policies is missing in HTTP responses.

KAT-NO-EXPLICIT-XSS-PROTECTION.description: The cross-site scripting filter of Internet Explorer, Chrome and Safari is not enabled explicitly.

KAT-NO-X-FRAME-OPTIONS.description: HTTP header 'X-Frame-Options' is missing. It is possible that the website can be loaded via an <iframe>.

KAT-NO-X-DNS-PREFETCH-CONTROL.description: The HTTP header X-DNS-Prefetch-Control is missing.

KAT-NO-EXCPECT-CT.description: HTTP header 'Expect-CT' is missing. The Expect-CT header allows sites to opt in to reporting and/or enforcement of Certificate Transparency requirements.

KAT-NO-PERMISSIONS-POLICY.description: The HTTP header Permissions-Policy is missing. Via this header a website can set limits on what kind of capabilities a web pages is allowed to access in browsers that render them. For example, the header can prohibit the web page from addressing the microphone, camera, location or phone sensors.

KAT-NO-REFERRER-POLICY.description: The HTTP header Referrer-Policy is missing in HTTP responses.

KAT-NO-X-CONTENT-TYPE-OPTIONS.description: The HTTP header <c>X-Content-Type- Options</c> is not set. Internet Explorer and Chrome apply MIME type sniffing in order to guess the content type of a document served and ignore the file extension.

KAT-SSL-2-SUPPORT.description: The server supports SSL version 2. This is a protocol that encrypts data traffic through an old and very discouraged protocol which has serious vulnerabilities.

KAT-SSL-3-SUPPORT.description: The server supports SSL version 3. This is a protocol that encrypts data traffic through an old and very discouraged protocol which has serious vulnerabilities.

KAT-TLS-1.0-SUPPORT.description: The server supports TLS version 1.0. This is a protocol that encrypts data traffic through a deprecated and discouraged protocol which has security risks.

KAT-TLS-1.1-SUPPORT.description: The server supports TLS version 1.1. This is a protocol that encrypts data traffic through a deprecated and discouraged protocol which has security risks.

KAT-TLS-1.1-AND-1.2-SUPPORT.description: The server supports TLS version 1.0 and 1,1. These are protocols that encrypts data traffic using deprecated and discouraged protocols that contain security risks.

KAT-NO-TLS-1.2.description: TLS version 1.2 is not supported. This is a current and recommended protocol that securely encrypts data traffic.

KAT-NO-TLS-1.3.description: TLS version 1.3 is not supported. This is a current and recommended protocol that securely encrypts data traffic.

KAT-NO-TLS-FALLBACK-SCSV.description: The encrypted connection provides no protection against downgrade attacks.

KAT-OPEN-SYSADMIN-PORT.description: A system administration port is open.

KAT-UNCOMMON-OPEN-PORT.description: The firewall may be configured in a riskful manner.

KAT-OPEN-COMMON-PORT.description: A port commonly used was found to be open.

KAT-WEBSERVER-NO-IPV6.description: We check if there is at least one AAAA record with IPv6 address for your web server. For this website there is no web server with an IPv6 address available.

KAT-NAMESERVER-IPV6-NOT-REACHABLE.description: We check if all name servers, that have an AAAA record with IPv6 address, are reachable over IPv6. One or more name servers is not reachable on an IPv6 address.

KAT-WEBSERVER-IPV6-NOT-REACHABLE.description: We check if all web servers, that have an AAAA record with IPv6 address, are reachable over IPv6. In this case the web server(s) is/are not reachable via IPv6.

KAT-NOT-ENOUGH-IPV6-NAMESERVERS.description: We check if we can connect to your name server(s) over IPv6 on any available ports (80 and/or 443). We test all IPv6 addresses that we receive from your name servers. For this website there are not enough name servers accessible via IPv6.

KAT-IPV4-IPV6-INCONSISTENT.description: We compare the web content that we receive from the web server over both IPv6 and IPv4 on any available ports (80 and/or 443). In case there are multiple IPv6 and IPv4 addresses, we pick one IPv6 address and one IPv4 address. If the content difference is not higher than 10%, we expect the main web content to be the same. In this case the websites hosted on IPv4 and IPv6 for the given hostname are not the same.

KAT-NO-DNSSEC.description: We check if your domain, more specifically its SOA record, is DNSSEC signed. The provided domain is not DNSSEC signed.

KAT-INVALID-DNSSEC.description: We check if your domain, more specifically its SOA record, is DNSSEC signed. The provided domain is DNSSEC signed, but the DNSSEC is invalid.

KAT-HSTS-VULNERABILITIES.description: List of vulnerabilities found in the HTTP strict transport security (HSTS) settings of the http header.

KAT-CSP-VULNERABILITIES.description: List of vulnerabilities found in the content security policy (CSP) settings of the http header.

KAT-JAVASCRIPT-VULNERABILITIES.description: List of vulnerabilities found in outdated javascript libraries.

KAT-POTENTIAL-MALWARE.description: This software is known to be used as malware.

KAT-EXPOSED-SOFTWARE.description: This software should not be exposed to the Internet.

KAT-INVALID-SPF-SYNTAX.description: SPF record does not have valid syntax.

KAT-612.description: Parsing an SPF record should require no more than 10 DNS lookups.

KAT-SPF-TOO-LONG.description: SPF record exceeds allowed length of 255 characters.

KAT-INVALID-IP-IN-SPF.description: An invalid ip address was found in the SPF record.

KAT-SPF-REDIRECT-LOOP.description: The SPF record contains a redirect loop.

KAT-616.description: The 'all' mechanism should be configured to be fail (='-').

KAT-617.description: The 'exists' mechanism should not be used.

KAT-SPF-INCLUDE-LOOP.description: The SPF record contains an include loop.

KAT-619.description: The 'ptr' mechanism should not be used.

KAT-10-OR-MORE-NEW-PORTS-OPEN.description: A lot of ports are open which were not open a week ago.

KAT-LEAKIX-CRITICAL.description: A leak with severity critical has been found.

KAT-LEAKIX-HIGH.description: A leak with severity high has been found.

KAT-LEAKIX-MEDIUM.description: A leak with severity medium has been found.

KAT-LEAKIX-LOW.description: A leak with severity low has been found.

KAT-LEAKIX-RECOMMENDATION.description: A leak with severity information has been found.

KAT-SOFTWARE-UPDATE-AVAILABLE.description: There is a newer version for this software.

KAT-NO-GREEN-HOSTING.description: According to the Green Web Foundation, this website is not hosted in a 'green' way.

KAT-NXDOMAIN.description: The domain name does not exist.

KAT-NXDOMAIN-HEADER.description: The hostname in this header does not exist.

KAT-NAMESERVER-NO-TWO-IPV6.description: This webserver does not have at least two nameservers with an ipv6 address.

KAT-NAMESERVER-NO-IPV6.description: This nameserver does not have an ipv6 address.

KAT-INTERNETNL.description: This website does not comply to the internet.nl standards. Currently, we check the following standards: IPv6 on webservers and nameservers, DNSSEC, missing and mis-configured headers.

KAT-NO-CERTIFICATE.description: This website does not have an SSL certificate. This finding might be caused by an unfinished certificate scan.

KAT-SSL-CERT-HOSTNAME-MISMATCH.description: The common name of the certificate does not match the netloc of the website

KAT-NO-HTTPS-REDIRECT.description: This HTTP URL may not redirect to HTTPS; 'location' was not found in HTTPHeader.

KAT-NO-DMARC.description: This hostname does not have a DMARC record.

KAT-NO-DKIM.description: This hostname does not support a DKIM record.

KAT-NO-SPF.description: This hostname does not have an SPF record.

KAT-INVALID-SPF.description: This SPF record could not be parsed by the internet.nl SPF parser and is therefore deemed invalid.

SUB-DOMAIN-TAKEOVER.description: Subdomain takeover is when an attacker takes control of an unused or improperly configured subdomain, potentially accessing sensitive information or conducting phishing attacks.

EXPOSED-PANELS.description: Exposed login panels for services can pose security risks as they can be targeted by malicious actors for brute-force attacks, phishing attempts, and other forms of unauthorized access.
